p: In contrast, protozoan diseases such as Malaria have been known since the fifth century BCE, when Hippocrates described it as a disease associated with the bad quality of air close to swamps (mal = bad; aria = air) ( 26). In addition, references to Malaria have also been found in Egyptian mummies, during Roman times, and in the European Renaissance ( 26). However, although the first description of Malaria dates back 2500 years, no vaccine against Malaria has yet been licensed. This large delay confirms that Malaria is one of the most important neglected diseases.
